radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal ribs and vertebrae; significantly decreased transmittance of both lungs, presenting as white lung in line with neonatal respiratory distress syndrome (NRDS) grade IV.

Enlarged kidneys with enhanced echogenicity and multiple cysts; non-dilated bilateral ureters and non-filled bladder; enlarged pancreas with uneven parenchymal echogenicity enhancement; liver with uneven echogenicity and no intrahepatic bile duct dilation.

Pulmonary hypertension; minor pulmonary valve regurgitation; patent ductus arteriosus; reduced left ventricular systolic function (LVEF: 43.5%, LVFS: 19%); normal cardiac position, myocardial echogenicity, and thickness.
Bilateral pleural effusion (left 1.3 cm, right 0.3 cm).
Little abdominal bowel inflation and an absence of colon inflation.
